intro: Chaetanthera brachylepis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved chaetanthera, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its leaves are narrow and have a distinctive, slightly hairy texture.
